question: What is Bayesian haplotyping used for?
ideal_answer: Bayesian haplotype inference is used for phylogenetic analysis, specifcially multiple linked single-nucleotide polymorphisms and analysis of chromosome copy number and deletions.

snippets.text: We employed Bayesian Inference (BI) methods for the phylogenetic reconstructions and divergence dating among lineages, using unique haplotype sequences from two mitochondrial loci (COXI, 16S) and one nuclear locus (28S).
Phylogenetic analyses of mitogenome sequences by maximum likelihood (ML) and Bayesian inference identified a monophyletic RSA clade, subdivided into two clades.
